resources.string: You don\'t start out writing good stuff. You start out writing crap and thinking it\'s good stuff, and then gradually you get better at it. That\'s why I say one of the most valuable traits is persistence.
The lyf so short, the craft so long to lerne.
I wanted to be a writer, so I became one. How? I wrote things down.
The road to hell is paved with adverbs.
Brevity is the soul of wit.
There is a time for many words, and there is also a time for sleep.
Writing is really a way of thinkingâ€”not just feeling but thinking about things that are disparate, unresolved, mysterious, problematic or just sweet.
All art is a kind of confession, more or less oblique. All artists, if they are to survive, are forced, at last, to tell the whole story; to vomit the anguish up.
The act of writing requires a constant plunging back into the shadow of the past where time hovers ghostlike.

Fantasy is escapist, and that is its glory. If a soldier is imprisoned by the enemy, don\'t we consider it his duty to escape?. . .If we value the freedom of mind and soul, if we\'re partisans of liberty, then it\'s our plain duty to escape, and to take as many people with us as we can!
